revised_title: Galaxy Clustering and the Dark Matter Problem: A Review of Theoretical Models
tldr: This article discusses the challenges in understanding galaxy clustering and the role of dark matter in the evolution of the universe. The author reviews various theoretical models, including those influenced by particle physics, to explain the observed patterns of galaxy clustering and the distribution of dark matter. The article highlights the importance of further research to better understand the relationship between galaxies and dark matter, as well as the implications for the overall structure and evolution of the universe.
